sentences.en: A coral reef is built by the accretion of tiny, identical organisms.
sentences.cn: 珊瑚礁是由许多相同的微生物不断堆积而成。

sentences.en: a proposal to protect several miles of thousand-year-old coral reef
sentences.cn: 保护绵延数英里的千年古珊瑚礁的提案

sentences.en: An unspoilt coral reef encloses the bay.
sentences.cn: 未受破坏的珊瑚礁环绕在海湾周围。

sentences.en: Beyond the coral reef the open sea was dark blue.
sentences.cn: 珊瑚礁之外的大海是一片深蓝色.

sentences.en: Big waves hammered at the coral reef.
sentences.cn: 大浪不断冲击着那珊瑚礁.

sentences.en: It's only been latterly that we've discovered that it's lots of individual reefs, around about 2,900 separate reef systems which make up the Great Barrier Reef.
sentences.cn: 直到近来我们才发现,它们其实是众多独立的礁石, 大约有2900个独立的礁石系,组成了大堡礁.

sentences.en: Seeing over a thousand species of fish is part of the fascination of the reef.
sentences.cn: 礁石的部分魅力就在于可以看到上千种鱼.

sentences.en: The captain ordered to reef the sails for docking.
The Main Chromitite Seam and the Merensky Reef do not outcrop well.
sentences.cn: 主铬铁岩矿层及麦仑斯基矿层出露不好.

sentences.en: the multifarious life forms in the coral reef
sentences.cn: 珊瑚礁上的多种生命形式

sentences.en: The ship struck on a reef.
The ship was bilged by a submerged reef.
sentences.cn: 船撞上暗礁,结果船底漏了.

sentences.en: The ship was wrecked on the hidden reef.
sentences.cn: 那艘船撞到暗礁沉没了.

sentences.en: They were wrecked on the reef.
sentences.cn: 他们因船触礁而遭遇海难.

sentences.en: Waves mountain - high broke over the reef.
With great difficulty, the fisherman manoeuvred his small craft close to the reef.
sentences.cn: 渔夫费了很大的劲才把他的小船划到暗礁旁。

words.tran_cn: 冰箱；方形短茄克；缩帆结；双排扣水手上衣；收帆的人
[海洋][水运]暗礁；[地质]矿脉；收帆

trans.tran_cn: 礁，暗礁，[矿]矿脉，[航]缩帆部，榫帆部
trans.tran_en: a line of sharp rocks, often made of coral, or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea
to tie up part of a sail in order to make it smaller
